SEARCH
Module makao
Package makao.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
makao.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, javafx.fxml.Initializable, AceListener, JackListener
public class GameController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, AceListener, JackListener, Serializable
GameController is the main class responsible for controlling the game logic and communication between the server and the client. It implements Initializable, AceListener, JackListener, and Serializable interfaces.
See Also:

    • init

      public void init(ServerMessage msgFromServer, String name)
      Initializes the game by setting up the player's information and updating the UI elements.
      Parameters:
      msgFromServer - The message received from the server containing information about the game state.
      name - The name of the current player.

      public void nextThisPlayerMove(ServerMessage msgFromServer)

      Parameters:
      msgFromServer - The message from the server containing information about the current game state.

    • updateStateOfRoundLabels

      public void updateStateOfRoundLabels(StateOfRound stateOfRound)
      Updates the state of round labels by setting the text of the "cards to draw" label to the number of cards to draw, the "chosen color" label to the chosen color, the "requested value" label to the requested value, and the "rounds to wait" label to the number of rounds to wait.
      Parameters:
      stateOfRound - the current state of the round

    • updateDeckView

      public void updateDeckView()
      Updates the deck view by making it visible and hiding the "wait rounds" button.

    • initSelectedCardHBox

      public void initSelectedCardHBox()
      Initializes the selected card HBox by making each ImageView in the HBox invisible, and adding a mouse click event to each ImageView that calls the "chooseSelectedCard" method.

    • chooseCard

      public void chooseCard(javafx.scene.image.ImageView chosenCardView)
      Initializes the cards in hand HBox by making each ImageView in the HBox invisible, and adding a mouse click event to each ImageView that calls the "chooseCard" method if it is the current player's round.
      Parameters:
      chosenCardView - cards in the player's hand

      Returns:
      int index of the chosen card

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard()
      The method is used to draw a card from the deck and update the state of the game accordingly. The method updates the GUI by setting the image of the card and showing the options to the user. It also updates the state of the round and the cards of the player.

    • changeSceneToRanking

      public void changeSceneToRanking(ServerMessage msgFromServer) throws IOException
      The method is used to change the scene to the ranking scene. The method updates the GUI by closing the current window and opening the ranking scene window. It also updates the state of the ranking and the client.
      Parameters:
      msgFromServer - ServerMessage object which contains the ranking and winner of the game.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • changeSceneToQuit

      public void changeSceneToQuit() throws IOException
      The method is used to change the scene to the quit scene. The method updates the GUI by closing the current window and opening the quit scene window.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • endOfThisPlayerRound

      public void endOfThisPlayerRound()
      Ends the current player round and sends a message to the client indicating if the player won or not.

    • tryToPlayCards

      public void tryToPlayCards()
      Attempts to play the chosen cards. If the cards are not allowed to be played, an alert is shown and the cards are put back.

    • updateStackView

      public void updateStackView(StateOfRound stateOfRound)
      Updates the stack view to display the last card played.
      Parameters:
      stateOfRound - The current state of the round

    • showSelectedCards

      public void showSelectedCards()
      Shows the cards that the player has selected.

    • clearViews

      public void clearViews(int firstView, int lastView, javafx.scene.layout.HBox viewsHBox)

    • setView

      public void setView(Card card, javafx.scene.layout.HBox viewsHBox, int index)

    • showCards

      public void showCards()
      Shows the cards in the hand of the player. It gets the cards in hand of the player and sets the number of cards in the bottom row. It clears the views for the up row and bottom row and sets the view for each card.

    • waitRounds

      public void waitRounds()
      Used to wait for the player's round. It calls the waitRounds method on the player and updates the deck view. It then calls the endOfThisPlayerRound method.

    • aceWasPlayed

      public CardColour aceWasPlayed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Called when an Ace is played It creates a ChoiceDialog to ask the player what color they want and returns the chosen color.
      Specified by:
      aceWasPlayed in interface AceListener
      Parameters:
      event - the event that triggers the method
      Returns:
      the chosen color

    • jackWasPlayed

      public CardValue jackWasPlayed(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      The jackWasPlayed method is called when a jack card is played. It creates a choice dialog that prompts the user to select a card value from a list of predefined values. The selected value is then returned.
      Specified by:
      jackWasPlayed in interface JackListener
      Parameters:
      event - the event that triggers this method
      Returns:
      the selected card value

    • playerWaitsInThisRound

      public void playerWaitsInThisRound(int roundsToStay)
      The playerWaitsInThisRound method is called when a player chooses to wait during their turn. It displays an alert dialog with information about how many rounds the player has to wait.
      Parameters:
      roundsToStay - the number of rounds the player has to wait
